item.title: 百度成为中国最便宜的互联网股票，人工智能备受关注
item.description: 由于对前景的担忧，百度公司股价表现不佳，使其成为中国主要互联网公司中估值最便宜的公司。【原文：Sharp stock underperformance for Baidu Inc. on concerns over its outlook have left it trading at the cheapest valuation among China’s major internet firms.】

item.title: 借贷成本上升为印度中小型企业带来新风险
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 日本 20 年期政府债券收益率升至 1999 年以来最高点
item.description: 受对财政扩张的持续担忧和主要投资者需求减弱的影响，日本超长期国债收益率攀升至数十年高位。【原文：Yields on Japan’s super-long government bonds climbed to multi-decade highs, driven by persistent concerns over fiscal expansion and fading demand from key investors.】

item.title: 美国住房前景堪忧加剧 James Hardie 股价暴跌
item.description: 詹姆斯-哈迪工业公司（James Hardie Industries Plc）股价连续第二天暴跌，在令人失望的财报和对美国房地产市场的担忧之后，分析师们急忙下调了目标股价。【原文：James Hardie Industries Plc shares plummeted for a second day, with analysts rushing to cut their price targets after disappointing earnings results and concerns over the US housing market.】

item.title: 印度成为罕见的绿色 IPO 中心，交易额达 40 亿美元
item.description: 随着印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）对可再生能源的大力推动，印度的清洁能源首次公开募股正在复苏。【原文：India is seeing a revival in clean-energy initial public offerings as companies capitalize on Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s push for renewables.】

item.title: StanChart 固定收益研究全球主管鲁德拉退休
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）固定收益研究部全球主管考希克-鲁德拉（Kaushik Rudra）在该行工作 17 年后退休。【原文：Kaushik Rudra, global head of fixed-income research at Standard Chartered Plc, has retired after 17 years at the bank, according to a company email.】

item.title: 中国 30 年期债券收益率跃升至今年最高水平
item.description: 中国 30 年期国债收益率升至今年以来的最高水平，原因是市场预期与美国的贸易谈判将取得有利成果，以及中国政府将努力促进经济发展，这刺激了交易商从债券转向股票。【原文：China’s 30-year yield rose to its highest level this year as expectations of a favorable outcome from trade talks with the US and Beijing’s efforts to bolster the economy spur traders to switch to stocks from bonds.】

item.title: 台湾 2,350 亿美元养老金避开香港公司委托业务
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，台湾最大的养老基金之一已指导外部公司不要使用在香港注册的实体来管理其资金，这凸显了台湾金融中心在深化与中国大陆的关系时所面临的地缘政治挑战。【原文：One of Taiwan’s largest pension funds has guided outside firms against using Hong Kong-registered entities to manage its money, according to people familiar with the matter, underscoring the geopolitical challenges facing the financial hub as it deepens ties with mainland China.】

item.title: 警方称博尔索纳罗在信中酝酿 "紧急 "庇护阿根廷
item.description: 根据警方在巴西前总统博尔索纳罗的手机上发现的一封信草稿，他曾考虑在阿根廷申请政治庇护，联邦执法部门将此视为这位极右翼领导人计划逃离巴西以躲避未来逮捕的证据。【原文：Brazil’s former President Jair Bolsonaro considered requesting political asylum in Argentina, according to a draft letter found by police on his phone, evidence that federal law enforcement see as proof the far-right leader planned to flee the country to sidestep a future arrest.】

item.title: 特朗普称美联储理事库克应辞职后黄金保持涨势
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普呼吁美联储理事辞职，引发了人们对央行独立性的新担忧，刺激了避险需求，黄金因此保持涨势。【原文：Gold held a gain after President Donald Trump’s call for a Federal Reserve governor to quit raised fresh concerns about the central bank’s independence, bolstering haven demand.】

item.title: 新西兰在国防扩张中购买海军直升机和喷气机
item.description: 新西兰将购买新的海军直升机和空军喷气式飞机，这是新西兰提升军事能力以应对亚太地区日益紧张局势的第一步。【原文：New Zealand will buy new navy helicopters and airforce jets in the first steps toward upgrading its military capabilities to deal with rising tensions in the Asia-Pacific region.】

item.title: 人工智能裁员失败，澳大利亚最大银行反其道而行之
item.description: 在澳大利亚主要金融服务联盟的压力下，澳大利亚联邦银行撤销了因新人工智能技术而裁减 45 个客户服务职位的决定。【原文：Commonwealth Bank of Australia reversed a decision to cut 45 customer service roles due to new artificial intelligence technology after pressure from the country’s main financial services union.】

item.title: 医疗转运公司 Modivcare 申请破产
item.description: 医疗运输公司 Modivcare Inc.申请破产，以努力摆脱 11 亿美元的债务，因为联邦医疗保健资金的削减威胁到未来的现金流。【原文：Medical transportation firm Modivcare Inc. filed for bankruptcy in an effort to shed $1.1 billion of debt, after federal health-care funding cuts threatened to crimp future cash flows.】

item.title: 尽管美国加征关税，韩国早期出口仍表现出韧性
item.description: 韩国的早期出口数据显示，尽管美国全面加征关税继续对全球商业造成压力，但 8 月份迄今为止，韩国的海外出货量仍在保持增长。【原文：South Korea’s early exports data showed that shipments overseas have held up so far in August despite sweeping US tariffs that continue to weigh on global commerce.】

item.title: 美国库存出现两个月来最大降幅后，石油保持涨势
item.description: 在美国原油库存出现 6 月中旬以来的最大降幅，使库存远低于季节性平均水平之后，石油保持了涨势。【原文：Oil held a gain after US crude stockpiles shrunk the most since mid-June, keeping inventories well below the seasonal average.】

item.title: 鲍威尔讲话前股市退潮，债券攀升：市场综述
item.description: 在鲍威尔发表杰克逊霍尔（Jackson Hole）讲话之前，华尔街的交易波动使债券比股票更受青睐，因此亚洲股市周四开盘表现平淡。【原文：Asian equities were primed for a muted open Thursday as whipsawing trade on Wall Street favored bonds over stocks ahead of Jerome Powell’s Jackson Hole speech.】

item.title: 据说设备共享公司考虑最快今年在美国上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由 BDT & MSD Partners 支持的建筑设备租赁公司 EquipmentShare 正在考虑最快于今年进行首次公开募股。【原文：EquipmentShare, a construction equipment rental company backed by BDT & MSD Partners, is considering moving ahead with an IPO as soon as this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: FanDuel 与 CME 合作进行股票和商品投注
item.description: Flutter Entertainment Plc 旗下的在线博彩部门 FanDuel 正在与美国最大的衍生品交易所 CME Group Inc.【原文：FanDuel, the online gambling division of Flutter Entertainment Plc, is teaming up with CME Group Inc., the largest US derivatives exchange, to offer bets on stocks, commodity prices and even inflation.】

item.title: 香港销售强劲，友邦保险盈利能力指数上升
item.description: 友邦保險控股有限公司上半年新業務價值增長強勁，主要受惠於香港的保險銷售額。【原文：AIA Group Ltd. reported strong growth in new business value in the first half of the year, underpinned by insurance sales in Hong Kong.】

item.title: 朝日人寿受利率诱惑增持日本政府债券
item.description: 随着日本利率上升到有吸引力的水平，朝日生命保险相互会社（Asahi Mutual Life Insurance Co.【原文：Asahi Mutual Life Insurance Co. has diverted some of its 2025 investment outlay to domestic notes from foreign bonds as Japan’s interest rates rise to attractive levels.】

item.title: 菲律宾债券看涨押注因指数纳入希望而增长
item.description: 由于有望进入主要的全球债券指数和当地进一步的货币宽松政策，菲律宾可能很快就会从东南亚政府债务排行榜的末尾崛起。【原文：The Philippines may soon rise from the bottom of Southeast Asia’s government debt leaderboard, thanks to the prospect of entering a major global bond index and further local monetary easing.】

item.title: 美联储主席库克称她不会被逼下台
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）不顾美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）因抵押贷款欺诈指控而要求她辞职的呼吁，表示她打算继续留在央行。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook signaled her intention to remain at the central bank in defiance of calls for her resignation by President Donald Trump over allegations of mortgage fraud.】

item.title: Palantir 的悲惨一周为陷入困境的短线股铸造了数十亿美元的财富
item.description: Palantir Technologies Inc.在股市上的六连跌已经抹去了 730 亿美元的市值，让做空者获得了一场罕见的胜利。【原文：Palantir Technologies Inc.’s six-session stock-market losing streak has wiped out $73 billion in market value, handing a rare win to short sellers who are getting pounded after betting against this year’s Wall Street juggernaut.】

item.title: 养老基金错过科技股反弹，转而投资完善型投资组合
item.description: 一些养老基金正在清醒地认识到一个残酷的现实：他们已经被市场最火热的涨势抛在后面。【原文：Some pension funds are waking up to a harsh reality: they’ve been left behind by the market’s hottest rally.】

item.title: Shamrock Capital 利用私人信贷收购 Penta 集团
item.description: 据知情人士透露，丘吉尔资产管理公司（Churchill Asset Management）牵头进行了一笔约 1.9 亿美元的私人信贷交易，以支持三叶草资本顾问公司（Shamrock Capital Advisors）收购通信和企业战略公司 Penta Group。【原文：Churchill Asset Management led a roughly $190 million private credit deal to support Shamrock Capital Advisors’s purchase of communications and corporate strategy firm Penta Group, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 微软活动人士在总部校园抗议与以色列的关系遭拘留
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp. ）的激进员工和支持者第二天返回公司总部，要求这家软件制造商断绝与以色列军方的业务联系，结果被警察拘留。【原文：Microsoft Corp. activist employees and supporters were detained by police after returning to the company’s headquarters for a second day to demand that the software maker sever business ties with the Israeli military.】

item.title: 米莱伊否决案在国会遭遇挫折，阿根廷债券下跌
item.description: 阿根廷主权债券周三下跌，此前立法者否决了哈维尔-米莱总统的一项提案，因为国会反对者在十月中期选举前反击了总统的紧缩运动。【原文：Argentine sovereign bonds fell Wednesday after lawmakers dealt a blow to one of President Javier Milei’s vetoes as congressional opponents pushed back against his austerity campaign before October midterm elections.】

item.title: 首席执行官薪酬飙升，更换首席执行官的成本也随之增加
item.description:
首席执行官的离职率创下新高。Big Take播客：更换首席执行官的隐性成本以及谁来买单。【原文：

CEOs are getting pushed out at record rates. On the Big Take podcast: the hidden costs of replacing a CEO and who foots the bill.

】

item.title: 受亚洲需求影响，美国原油出口将从夏季的低迷中反弹
item.description: 随着美国国内炼油厂开始预防性维护，以及特朗普政府威胁对购买俄罗斯石油的印度征收关税，美国原油出口在经历了一个低迷的夏季后终于开始回升。【原文：US crude exports are finally picking up after a muted summer as domestic refineries begin preventive maintenance and the Trump administration threatens tariffs on India for purchasing Russian oil.】

item.title: Entergy 公司获准为 Meta 数据中心新建天然气厂
item.description: 路易斯安那州公用事业监管机构批准了 Entergy 公司新建三座燃气电厂的计划，该电厂将为 Meta 在该州的数据中心提供电力。【原文：Louisiana’s utility regulator approved Entergy Corp.’s plan to build three new gas plants that will power Meta’s data center in the state, the company said in a news release Wednesday.】
